result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon W. Roth

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Brandon W. Roth
Current: 23 Herman St, Salamanca, NY 14779-1537 United States  (Effective: 05-15-2017)
Prior: N3663 Grahl Dr, Medford, WI 54451-9639

Defendant Brandon W. Roth in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Defendant freely and voluntarily waives right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of  guilty to Case No. 15CM26 - misd bail jumping and plea of guilty  to count 2 operating without a license in Case No. 15CM76.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court dismisses and read in Count 1 in Case No. 15CM76.  Court dismisses and read in Case No. 15CM113.   Court finds defendant guilty of 15CM26 - bail jumping and 15CM76 - operating without a license.  Court orders 15CM26 - $100.00 fine plus costs and DNA surcharge.  Case No. 15CM76 court orders $100.00 fine plus court costs and DNA sample and surcharge.  The fine and costs are to be paid at the rate of $50.00 a month beginning November 15, 2015.  Appeal rights given to defendant.  - rt
Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the court. Defendant shall comply with booking procedures at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.
Initial Appearance on November 3, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.

Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Brandon Roth appeared in person, in custody.  Court find probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty requests a $1,000.00 signature bond with booking.  Court orders $1,000.00 signature bond with booking.  Court ordered the clerk to begin bond revocation proceedings in Case Nos. 15CM76 and 15CM26.  Next court date is November 3, 2015 15 1;00 pm.  - rt
